description: Partial or complete removal of synovial tissue for specific inflammatory or pathological conditions (Evidence: pg no: 6, L203-L234)
scope: Partial or complete synovectomy (Evidence: pg no: 6, L203)

documentation: Individual demonstrates functionally limited range of motion (active or passive) on physical examination as compared to the non-involved side (Evidence: pg no: 6, L208-L209)
Failure of provider-directed non-surgical management for at least three (3) months in duration (Evidence: pg no: 6, L210-L211)
Advanced diagnostic imaging study (e.g., MRI, CT) demonstrates underlying pathology consistent with the individual's reported medical condition (Evidence: pg no: 6, L212-L214)

Presence of any ONE of the following: Inflammatory arthritis, Pigmented villonodular synovitis (PVNS), Synovial chondromatosis, Lyme synovitis, Hemophilia, Hemochromatosis, Non-specific synovitis, Recurrent hemarthrosis (Evidence: pg no: 6, L215-L231)

Other potential pathological conditions have been excluded including fracture, thoracic outlet syndrome, brachial plexus disorders, referred neck pain, and advanced glenohumeral osteoarthritis (Evidence: pg no: 6, L232-L234)

exclusions: Any other indication or condition (Evidence: pg no: 6, L236-L237)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, shoulder, surgical; synovectomy, partial (Evidence: pg no: 13, L560)
Arthroscopy, shoulder, surgical; synovectomy, complete (Evidence: pg no: 13, L561)

notes: Requires presence of specific underlying pathological conditions (Evidence: pg no: 6, L215)
